abstract: Sprint Nextel sells $6.5 billion of high-yield bonds. | The Verizon Wireless deal highlights what bankers describe as the continued health of the debt markets. | Mail.ru sells its remaining stake in Facebook for around $525 million. | Charles Schwab & Company is seeking to eliminate the option of class-action lawsuits for its clients.
snippet: Sprint Nextel sells $6.5 billion of high-yield bonds. | The Verizon Wireless deal highlights what bankers describe as the continued health of the debt markets. | Mail.ru sells its remaining stake in Facebook for around $525 million. | Charles Schw...
lead_paragraph: Sprint Nextel sold $6.5 billion of high-yield bonds on Wednesday, breaking the record for the single biggest noninvestment-grade offering ever sold directly to investors, DealBook’s Michael J. de la Merced reports. The deal shows that investors remain interested in buying up new debt, despite concerns about the Federal Reserve raising rates in the near future.
